com.github.mikephil.charting.interfaces.datasets

Interface IDataSet<T extends Entry>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IBarDataSet, IBarLineScatterCandleBubbleDataSet<T>, IBubbleDataSet, ICandleDataSet, ILineDataSet, ILineRadarDataSet<T>, ILineScatterCandleRadarDataSet<T>, IPieDataSet, IRadarDataSet, IScatterDataSet
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BarDataSet, BarLineScatterCandleBubbleDataSet, BaseDataSet, BubbleDataSet, CandleDataSet, DataSet, LineDataSet, LineRadarDataSet, LineScatterCandleRadarDataSet, PieDataSet, RadarDataSet, RealmBarDataSet, RealmBarLineScatterCandleBubbleDataSet, RealmBaseDataSet, RealmBubbleDataSet, RealmCandleDataSet, RealmLineDataSet, RealmLineRadarDataSet, RealmLineScatterCandleRadarDataSet, RealmPieDataSet, RealmRadarDataSet, RealmScatterDataSet, ScatterDataSet

    public interface IDataSet<T extends Entry>
    Created by Philipp Jahoda on 21/10/15.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addEntry(T e)
      Adds an Entry to the DataSet dynamically.
      void addEntryOrdered(T e)
      Adds an Entry to the DataSet dynamically.
      void calcMinMax(int start, int end)
      Calculates the minimum and maximum yPx yValue (mYMin, mYMax).
      void clear()
      Removes all values from this DataSet and does all necessary recalculations.
      boolean contains(T entry)
      Checks if this DataSet contains the specified Entry.
      YAxis.AxisDependency getAxisDependency()
      Returns the axis this DataSet should be plotted against.
      int getColor()
      Returns the first color (index 0) of the colors-array this DataSet contains.
      int getColor(int index)
      Returns the color at the given index of the DataSet's color array.
      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getColors()
      returns all the colors that are set for this DataSet
      int getEntryCount()
      Returns the number of yPx-values this DataSet represents -> the size of the yPx-values array -> yvals.size()
      T getEntryForIndex(int index)
      Returns the Entry object found at the given index (NOT xIndex) in the values array.
      T getEntryForXIndex(int xIndex)
      Returns the first Entry object found at the given xIndex with binary search.
      T getEntryForXIndex(int xIndex, DataSet.Rounding rounding)
      Returns the first Entry object found at the given xIndex with binary search.
      int getEntryIndex(int xIndex, DataSet.Rounding rounding)
      Returns the first Entry index found at the given xIndex with binary search.
      int getEntryIndex(T e)
      Returns the position of the provided entry in the DataSets Entry array.
      int getIndexInEntries(int xIndex)
      This method returns the actual index in the Entry array of the DataSet for a given xIndex.
      java.lang.String getLabel()
      Returns the label string that describes the DataSet.
      ValueFormatter getValueFormatter()
      Returns the formatter used for drawing the values inside the chart.
      int getValueTextColor()
      Returns only the first color of all colors that are set to be used for the values.
      int getValueTextColor(int index)
      Returns the color at the specified index that is used for drawing the values inside the chart.
      float getValueTextSize()
      Returns the text size that is used for drawing the values inside the chart
      Typeface getValueTypeface()
      Returns the typeface that is used for drawing the values inside the chart
      float getYMax()
      returns the maximum yPx-yValue this DataSet holds
      float getYMin()
      returns the minimum yPx-yValue this DataSet holds
      float getYValForXIndex(int xIndex)
      Returns the yValue of the Entry object at the given xIndex.
      boolean isDrawValuesEnabled()
      Returns true if yPx-yValue drawing is enabled, false if not
      boolean isHighlightEnabled()
      returns true if highlighting of values is enabled, false if not
      boolean isVisible()
      Returns true if this DataSet is visible inside the chart, or false if it is currently hidden.
      boolean removeEntry(int xIndex)
      Removes the Entry object that has the given xIndex from the DataSet.
      boolean removeEntry(T e)
      Removes an Entry from the DataSets entries array.
      boolean removeFirst()
      Removes the first Entry (at index 0) of this DataSet from the entries array.
      boolean removeLast()
      Removes the last Entry (at index size-1) of this DataSet from the entries array.
      void setAxisDependency(YAxis.AxisDependency dependency)
      Set the yPx-axis this DataSet should be plotted against (either LEFT or RIGHT).
      void setDrawValues(boolean enabled)
      set this to true to draw yPx-values on the chart NOTE (for bar and linechart): if "maxvisiblecount" is reached, no values will be drawn even if this is enabled
      void setHighlightEnabled(boolean enabled)
      If set to true, yValue highlighting is enabled which means that values can be highlighted programmatically or by touch gesture.
      void setLabel(java.lang.String label)
      Sets the label string that describes the DataSet.
      void setValueFormatter(ValueFormatter f)
      Sets the formatter to be used for drawing the values inside the chart.
      void setValueTextColor(int color)
      Sets the color the yValue-labels of this DataSet should have.
      void setValueTextColors(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> colors)
      Sets a list of colors to be used as the colors for the drawn values.
      void setValueTextSize(float size)
      Sets the text-size of the yValue-labels of this DataSet in dp.
      void setValueTypeface(Typeface tf)
      Sets a Typeface for the yValue-labels of this DataSet.
      void setVisible(boolean visible)
      Set the visibility of this DataSet.

      • getYMin

        float getYMin()
        returns the minimum yPx-yValue this DataSet holds
        Returns:

      • getYMax

        float getYMax()
        returns the maximum yPx-yValue this DataSet holds
        Returns:

      • getEntryCount

        int getEntryCount()
        Returns the number of yPx-values this DataSet represents -> the size of the yPx-values array -> yvals.size()
        Returns:

      • calcMinMax

        void calcMinMax(int start,
              int end)
        Calculates the minimum and maximum yPx yValue (mYMin, mYMax). From the specified starting to ending index.
        Parameters:
        start - starting index in your data list
        end - ending index in your data list

      • getEntryForXIndex

        T getEntryForXIndex(int xIndex)
        Returns the first Entry object found at the given xIndex with binary search. If the no Entry at the specified xPx-index is found, this method returns the index at the closest xPx-index. Returns null if no Entry object at that index. INFORMATION: This method does calculations at runtime. Do not over-use in performance critical situations.
        Parameters:
        xIndex -
        Returns:

      • getEntryForXIndex

        T getEntryForXIndex(int xIndex,
                  DataSet.Rounding rounding)
        Returns the first Entry object found at the given xIndex with binary search. If the no Entry at the specified xPx-index is found, this method returns the index at the closest xPx-index. Returns null if no Entry object at that index. INFORMATION: This method does calculations at runtime. Do not over-use in performance critical situations.
        Parameters:
        xIndex -
        rounding - determine to round up/down/closest if there is no Entry matching the provided xPx-index
        Returns:

      • getEntryForIndex

        T getEntryForIndex(int index)
        Returns the Entry object found at the given index (NOT xIndex) in the values array.
        Parameters:
        index -
        Returns:

      • getEntryIndex

        int getEntryIndex(int xIndex,
                DataSet.Rounding rounding)
        Returns the first Entry index found at the given xIndex with binary search. If the no Entry at the specified xPx-index is found, this method returns the index at the closest xPx-index. Returns -1 if no Entry object at that index. INFORMATION: This method does calculations at runtime. Do not over-use in performance critical situations.
        Parameters:
        xIndex -
        rounding - determine to round up/down/closest if there is no Entry matching the provided xPx-index
        Returns:

      • getEntryIndex

        int getEntryIndex(T e)
        Returns the position of the provided entry in the DataSets Entry array. Returns -1 if doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        e -
        Returns:

      • getYValForXIndex

        float getYValForXIndex(int xIndex)
        Returns the yValue of the Entry object at the given xIndex. Returns Float.NaN if no yValue is at the given xPx-index. INFORMATION: This method does calculations at runtime. Do not over-use in performance critical situations.
        Parameters:
        xIndex -
        Returns:

      • getIndexInEntries

        int getIndexInEntries(int xIndex)
        This method returns the actual index in the Entry array of the DataSet for a given xIndex. IMPORTANT: This method does calculations at runtime, do not over-use in performance critical situations.
        Parameters:
        xIndex -
        Returns:

      • addEntry

        boolean addEntry(T e)
        Adds an Entry to the DataSet dynamically. Entries are added to the end of the list. This will also recalculate the current minimum and maximum values of the DataSet and the yValue-sum.
        Parameters:
        e -

      • removeEntry

        boolean removeEntry(T e)
        Removes an Entry from the DataSets entries array. This will also recalculate the current minimum and maximum values of the DataSet and the yValue-sum. Returns true if an Entry was removed, false if no Entry could be removed.
        Parameters:
        e -

      • addEntryOrdered

        void addEntryOrdered(T e)
        Adds an Entry to the DataSet dynamically. Entries are added to their appropriate index respective to it's xPx-index. This will also recalculate the current minimum and maximum values of the DataSet and the yValue-sum.
        Parameters:
        e -

      • removeFirst

        boolean removeFirst()
        Removes the first Entry (at index 0) of this DataSet from the entries array. Returns true if successful, false if not.
        Returns:

      • removeLast

        boolean removeLast()
        Removes the last Entry (at index size-1) of this DataSet from the entries array. Returns true if successful, false if not.
        Returns:

      • removeEntry

        boolean removeEntry(int xIndex)
        Removes the Entry object that has the given xIndex from the DataSet. Returns true if an Entry was removed, false if no Entry could be removed.
        Parameters:
        xIndex -

      • contains

        boolean contains(T entry)
        Checks if this DataSet contains the specified Entry. Returns true if so, false if not. NOTE: Performance is pretty bad on this one, do not over-use in performance critical situations.
        Parameters:
        entry -
        Returns:

      • clear

        void clear()
        Removes all values from this DataSet and does all necessary recalculations.

        Returns the label string that describes the DataSet.

        Sets the label string that describes the DataSet.
        Parameters:

      • getAxisDependency

        YAxis.AxisDependency getAxisDependency()
        Returns the axis this DataSet should be plotted against.
        Returns:

      • setAxisDependency

        void setAxisDependency(YAxis.AxisDependency dependency)
        Set the yPx-axis this DataSet should be plotted against (either LEFT or RIGHT). Default: LEFT
        Parameters:
        dependency -

      • getColors

        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getColors()
        returns all the colors that are set for this DataSet
        Returns:

      • getColor

        int getColor()
        Returns the first color (index 0) of the colors-array this DataSet contains. This is only used for performance reasons when only one color is in the colors array (size == 1)
        Returns:

      • getColor

        int getColor(int index)
        Returns the color at the given index of the DataSet's color array. Performs a IndexOutOfBounds check by modulus.
        Parameters:
        index -
        Returns:

      • isHighlightEnabled

        boolean isHighlightEnabled()
        returns true if highlighting of values is enabled, false if not
        Returns:

      • setHighlightEnabled

        void setHighlightEnabled(boolean enabled)
        If set to true, yValue highlighting is enabled which means that values can be highlighted programmatically or by touch gesture.
        Parameters:
        enabled -

      • setValueFormatter

        void setValueFormatter(ValueFormatter f)
        Sets the formatter to be used for drawing the values inside the chart. If no formatter is set, the chart will automatically determine a reasonable formatting (concerning decimals) for all the values that are drawn inside the chart. Use chart.getDefaultValueFormatter() to use the formatter calculated by the chart.
        Parameters:
        f -

      • getValueFormatter

        ValueFormatter getValueFormatter()
        Returns the formatter used for drawing the values inside the chart.
        Returns:

      • setValueTextColor

        void setValueTextColor(int color)
        Sets the color the yValue-labels of this DataSet should have.
        Parameters:
        color -

      • setValueTextColors

        void setValueTextColors(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> colors)
        Sets a list of colors to be used as the colors for the drawn values.
        Parameters:
        colors -

      • setValueTypeface

        void setValueTypeface(Typeface tf)
        Sets a Typeface for the yValue-labels of this DataSet.
        Parameters:
        tf -

      • setValueTextSize

        void setValueTextSize(float size)
        Sets the text-size of the yValue-labels of this DataSet in dp.
        Parameters:
        size -

      • getValueTextColor

        int getValueTextColor()
        Returns only the first color of all colors that are set to be used for the values.
        Returns:

      • getValueTextColor

        int getValueTextColor(int index)
        Returns the color at the specified index that is used for drawing the values inside the chart. Uses modulus internally.
        Parameters:
        index -
        Returns:

      • getValueTypeface

        Typeface getValueTypeface()
        Returns the typeface that is used for drawing the values inside the chart
        Returns:

      • getValueTextSize

        float getValueTextSize()
        Returns the text size that is used for drawing the values inside the chart
        Returns:

      • setDrawValues

        void setDrawValues(boolean enabled)
        set this to true to draw yPx-values on the chart NOTE (for bar and linechart): if "maxvisiblecount" is reached, no values will be drawn even if this is enabled
        Parameters:
        enabled -

      • isDrawValuesEnabled

        boolean isDrawValuesEnabled()
        Returns true if yPx-yValue drawing is enabled, false if not
        Returns:

      • setVisible

        void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Set the visibility of this DataSet. If not visible, the DataSet will not be drawn to the chart upon refreshing it.
        Parameters:
        visible -

      • isVisible

        boolean isVisible()
        Returns true if this DataSet is visible inside the chart, or false if it is currently hidden.
        Returns:
